contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=August 2009}} A '''glowworm''' is a luminous trail of a tiny [[meteor]], occasionally visible in the night sky during a [[meteor shower]]. The centimeter-sized [[comet]] pieces can produce hundreds of [[Meteoroid|fireballs]] or more each hour. In some cases, particularly during the [[Leonids]], the fireballs make bright trails that can stay up for 10 to 15 minutes, according to [[astronomer]]s. ==External links== *[http://www.cnn.com/2003/TECH/space/11/18/meteor.shower.ap/ Leonid meteors may spawn 'glowworms'] - CNN Science and Space {{Dead link|date=August 2009}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Glowworm (Astronomy)}} [[Category:Meteoroids]]
